name: Deathwisp
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathwisp makes two Ghostly Pike attacks, or it can make one Ghostly Pike attack and one Life Drain attack.

actions.name: Ghostly Pike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

actions.name: Create Specter
actions.desc: The deathwisp targets a Humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. This specter is under the deathwisp's control. The deathwisp can have no more than twelve specters under its control at one time.

special_abilities.name: Flicker
special_abilities.desc: The deathwisp flickers in and out of sight. Ranged weapon attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

special_abilities.name: Incorporeal Movement
special_abilities.desc: The deathwisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the deathwisp has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

special_abilities.name: Undead Nature
special_abilities.desc: The deathwisp doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
